intro: Conostegia puberula, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically thrives in sandy or well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along roadsides. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape and covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its common name. Conostegia puberula is known for its ability to tolerate drought and poor soil conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
